org.jcp.jsr94.tck.util
Class TestCaseUtil

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.jcp.jsr94.tck.util.TestCaseUtil
public abstract class TestCaseUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for the JSR-94 TCK.

This class implements several convenience methods for accessing a rule session. It will parse the "tck.conf" configuration file. The "tck.conf" configuration file is located in the lib directory of the tck distribution.

Since:
JSR-94 1.0
Version:
1.0

TestCaseUtil

public TestCaseUtil()
Method Detail

getRuleServiceProvider

public static java.lang.String getRuleServiceProvider()
Get the rule service provider configuration setting. This method will parse the tck.conf configuration file and return the definition of the rule-service-provider. This definition should contain a valid class name for the rule engine vendor specific implementation of the RuleServiceProvider.
Returns:
The class name of a RuleServiceProvider implementation.

getRuleServiceProvider

public static RuleServiceProvider getRuleServiceProvider(java.lang.String uri,
                                                         java.net.URL[] urls)
                                                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                         ConfigurationException
This method complements the previous method. We suppose that the rule provider implementation classes are stored in stand-alone JAR files provided as URLs. The method creates a URLClassLoader, loads the RuleServiceProvider class from the class loader, then registers the object using the class loader. Note: we need to take care about the CLASSPATH when launching this test.
Parameters:
uri - The registration name of this rule service provider.
urls - The URLs which provide the rule service provoider classes.
Returns:
The registered provider.

getRuleExecutionSetLocation

public static java.lang.String getRuleExecutionSetLocation()
Get the rule execution set location sconfiguration setting. This method will parse the tck.conf configuration file and return the location of the rule execution sets.
Returns:
The location of the rule execution sets.

getRuleServiceProviderJarURLs

public static java.util.Vector getRuleServiceProviderJarURLs()
Get the rule service provider's jar files URLs.
Returns:
A vector of URLs of the jar file names of the rule service provider.

getRuleServiceProvider

public static RuleServiceProvider getRuleServiceProvider(java.lang.String uri)
                                                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                         ConfigurationException
Get a RuleServiceProvider.

Get a rule engine vendor specific rule service provider. The provider is constucted in the following manner:

  • Get the "rule-service-provider" from the configuration file.
  • Load the RuleServiceProvider class specified by this property.
  • Register this RuleServiceProvider class.
Parameters:
uri - The registration name of this rule service provider.
Returns:
The registered provider.

getStatefulRuleSession

public static StatefulRuleSession getStatefulRuleSession(java.lang.String uri,
                                                         java.lang.String ruleExecutionSetUri)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Get a StatefulRuleSession.

Get a stateful rule session. The provider is constucted in the following manner:

  • Get a RuleServiceProvider getRuleServiceProvider().
  • Get the RuleAdministrator and create/register a rule execution set.
  • Get the RuleRuntime and create a rule session on the registered rule execution set.

Note:
The location of the rule execution sets is specified in the tck.conf configuration file with the tag "rule-execution-set-location".

Parameters:
uri - The registration name of this rule service provider.
ruleExecutionSetUri - The file name of the rule execution set
Returns:
The stateful rule session.

getStatelessRuleSession

public static StatelessRuleSession getStatelessRuleSession(java.lang.String uri,
                                                           java.lang.String ruleExecutionSetUri)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Get a StatelessRuleSession.

Get a stateless rule session. The provider is constucted in the following manner:

  • Get a RuleServiceProvider getRuleServiceProvider().
  • Get the RuleAdministrator and create/register a rule execution set.
  • Get the RuleRuntime and create a rule session on the registered rule execution set.

Note:
The location of the rule execution sets is specified in the tck.conf configuration file with the tag "rule-execution-set-location".

Parameters:
uri - The registration name of this rule service provider.
ruleExecutionSetUri - The file name of the rule execution set
Returns:
The stateless rule session.

getRuleExecutionSetInputStream

public static java.io.InputStream getRuleExecutionSetInputStream(java.lang.String ruleExecutionSetUri)
Get a rule execution set input stream. This method will return an input stream to the RuleExecutionSet for the specified uri. Note:
The location of the rule execution sets is specified in the tck.conf configuration file with the tag "rule-execution-set-location".
Parameters:
ruleExecutionSetUri - The file name of the rule execution set.
Returns:
The InputStream to the specified rule execution set.

getRuleExecutionSetReader

public static java.io.Reader getRuleExecutionSetReader(java.lang.String ruleExecutionSetUri)
Get a rule execution set reader. This method will return a Reader to the RuleExecutionSet for the specified uri. Note:
The location of the rule execution sets is specified in the tck.conf configuration file with the tag "rule-execution-set-location".
Parameters:
ruleExecutionSetUri - The file name of the rule execution set.
Returns:
The Reader to the specified rule execution set.

getRuleExecutionSetDocumentElement

public static org.w3c.dom.Element getRuleExecutionSetDocumentElement(java.lang.String ruleExecutionSetUri)
Get the DOM represenation for a rule execution set. This method will return a DOM representing the RuleExecutionSet for the specified uri. Note:
The location of the rule execution sets is specified in the tck.conf configuration file with the tag "rule-execution-set-location".
Parameters:
ruleExecutionSetUri - The file name of the rule execution set.
Returns:
The document Element to the specified rule execution set.

processTestException

public static void processTestException(java.lang.Exception e,
                                        junit.framework.TestCase test,
                                        java.lang.String methName)
Processes an unexpected exception thrown in a JUnit test method. This message extracts (if possible) the line number from the exception and displays appropriate information for easy debugging. Then it fails the test by calling fail.
Parameters:
e - The target exception to be processed.
test - The test case.
methName - The method name in which the exception is caught.
